metadata.dc:title: Professional self-steam in the scope of geriatric care
metadata.dc:description: Objective: to determine the self-steam of agroup of nursing professionals (nurse’s aides andregistered nurses) working in a public nursinghome in our community.Material and methods: a descriptive studywas carried out on 26 nursing professionalsworking at the Llar de Calvía nursing home with 66in-residents. The García Monge self-steam selfadministeredevaluation test was used to measureself-steam. This test measures three dimensions: I,the ideal one, I the real one, and I, the real one,through the eyes of others.Results: twenty-five nursing professionals werestudied. Higher scores were achieved for the “I, theideal one”. When the “I, the real one” was comparedagainst the “I, the Ideal one” some statisticallysignificant differences were found. The same occurredwhen the “I, the real one, through the eyes of others”was compared against “I, the ideal one”.Conclusions: the results point towards theexistence of low levels of self-steam in theseprofessionals that could be related to low levels ofw o r k - related satisfaction. Lastly, the need tointervene at diff e rent levels is addre s s e d :pregraduate training, postgraduate training andtraining at a organizational level
